title: Understanding Negative Symptoms
text: Negative symptoms in schizophrenia refer to the absence or reduction of normal behaviors and functions. These can include a lack of motivation, reduced emotional expression, and social withdrawal.

title: Examples of Negative Symptoms
text: Some common negative symptoms are anhedonia (inability to feel pleasure), alogia (reduced speech output), and avolition (lack of motivation).

title: Identifying Negative Symptoms
text: Which of the following is a negative symptom of schizophrenia?
choices: symptoms that are “added” to a person who is nonpsychotic. These include any changes to behaviors or thought content, consisting of excessive, distorted thoughts and perceptions and the presence of symptoms, including hallucinations and delusions
